column3: The precise type of the Raman spectroscopy / microscopy experiment. Admitted values: "Single spectrum"; "Line scan/mapping"; "Vertical mapping"; "2D mapping"; "3D mapping".
column15: From this attribute depends the population of some of the other fields below - e.g. the spatial resolution in the X/Y/Z direction makes sense only for scanning experiments in that direction

column2: excitation light power on the sample
column3: Power measured before the sample holder. It depends on the laser power and on the dispersive behaviour of the filters and optical components
A physical quality of the light source that is used used to excite a system to a higher energy state.
column14: This class needs to be defined in PATO or another more general ontology for such qualities.
column16: In general, use the label ending "...setting" coherently: either for all inputs (per hand or multiple choice) or never.

column3: A setting datum that specifies the duration in which an electromagnetic radiation beam is exposed to / recorded by a photosensor.
column14: This class should better be defined in a more general device ontology or a domain ontology with the scope of optical devices.

column3: The number of acquisitions on the same location, without position change.
The product of single integration time and number of repetitions.
column14: Remark the trade-off between signal-to-noise ratio and resolution.
column15: These three parameter together are redundant. Possibly the single exposure time is the one which can be sacrified.

column3: A setting datum that specifies the number of iterations performed in a spectroscopic measurement from which an aggregated assay output is generated.
column6: setting datum|('part of' some 'vibrational spectrometer configuration specification')
column13: The setting entered into a Raman microscope which specifies the desired number of measurements this Raman microscope has to perform to produce an usable Raman spectrum.
column14: This class should better be defined in a more general device ontology.

column3: A setting datum that specifies the operating temperature of a device.
column14: This class should better be defined in a more general device ontology.
column15: OK - often useful to know the operating temperature.When applied to 2D mappings, this would require a temperature record throughout the measurement time to be able to correlate deviations in the mapping with temperature fluctuations.
column16: A "temperature record" is more relevant rather than a "temperature setting", specially for long measurements (time-resolved record)

column3: The magnification factor of the objective collecting the scattered light.
A physical quality of a diffraction grating that represents the number of grooves per length unit (e.g. mm) on the surface that causes the diffraction of the light.
column14: This class should better be defined in a more general device ontology or a domain ontology with the scope of optical devices.
column15: OK, important parameter to calculate the spectral resolution.

column2: CCD sensor binning read mode setting
column3: A setting datum that specifies the binning read mode of a device with a CCD sensor.
column14: This class should better be defined in a more general device ontology or a domain ontology with the scope of optical devices.
column15: Which values can this property assume? Is it a density expressed in cm-1 / (virtual pixel)? Or (CCD pixel) / (virtual pixel)? It might be relevant as it contributes to the resolution / smoothing of the spectra, but in a complicated combination with the exit slit width
column16: spatial integration width would be a better label.

column3: The width of the region of interest in the X direction.
The number of measurement points in the X direction.
The number of points per unit length in the X direction.
Calculated from window size and window center.
Calculated from window size and window center.

The ratio between the height of the lowest relevant peak and the root-mena-square height of the background signal. It requires the (somehow arbitrary) choice about what is or is not a relevant signal.
